org.hayabaya

Class RunSettings

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.hayabaya.RunSettings

  • public class RunSettings
extends java.lang.Object
    All data related to the profiling experiment are saved in this singleton. This includes which of the data types are to be profiled and with what operations they are to be profiled. Information on the minimum length of arrays to test, their maximum length and the number of steps in between is also saved. Likewise the "CycleNumber" indicating how many times each operation is to be performed on each element of an array is saved in this class. The last type of information saved is the total number of times each experiment should be replicated. Created by cain on 4/20/2015.

    • Method Detail

      • getRunSettingsInstance

        public static RunSettings getRunSettingsInstance()

      • generateIntegerLinearSpace

        public static int[] generateIntegerLinearSpace(int minimumValue,
                                               int maximumValue,
                                               int incrementSize)
        Create an int[] array by specifying [From, To, ByStep]. Example: [1,6,2]=[1,3,5]. Be aware that in "fencepost" cases like (1,10,3) the function will be inclusive and add as needed to the array. This mean that the last element may exceed the specified MAX value Create an array of int[] starting from minimumValue, going up to (inclusive) maximumValue, in increments of incrementSize.
        Parameters:
        minimumValue - The starting value for the array
        maximumValue - The ending value for the array
        incrementSize - The increment size by which the elements of the array will increase by
        Returns:
        A variable length int[] array, in fencepost cases the method will be inclusive

      • exponentiateArray

        public static int[] exponentiateArray(int exponent,
                                      int[] linearArray)
        Exponentiate each element of an array by another number. 
             int[] a = {1, 2, 3, 4}
     int[] b = exponentiateArray(2, a)
     // a = [2, 4, 8, 16]
     exponentiateArray(3, {1, 2, 3, 4}) == [3, 9, 27, 81]
        Parameters:
        exponent - What number to exponentiate each of the elements into
        linearArray - An integer array to be exponentiated
        Returns:
        An integer array where each element has been raised to the power of the exponent

      • convertListToPrimitiveArray

        public static int[] convertListToPrimitiveArray(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> integers)
        Convert a Java ArrayList of integers into a primitive int[] array. This function does not throw an exception if any of the elements are null.
        Parameters:
        integers - list of integers to convert
        Returns:
        int[] returns an array of ints
